title: What's News --  World-Wide
text:
The Senate approved a $280 billion bill aimed at boosting the semiconductor industry crucial to modern technology, in a bipartisan embrace of expanding U.S. industrial policy to counter the competitive threat posed by China.

Manchin agreed to back a package aimed at lowering carbon emissions and curbing healthcare costs while raising corporate taxes, marking a stunning revival of core pieces of Biden's economic and climate agenda.

---

The U.S. has made a "substantial proposal" to free Brittney Griner and another American, Paul Whelan, from Russian detention, but the overture hasn't been accepted, Blinken said.

Ukraine used Himars rocket systems to again attack a key bridge into the strategic southern Ukrainian city of Kherson.

Russia followed through on promises to slash natural-gas flows to Europe, triggering a surge in prices for fuel and electricity.

---

Two senators are preparing bipartisan legislation that would give merchants power to process many Visa and Mastercard credit cards over different networks.

---

The man accused of firing on a July Fourth parade in Highland Park, Ill., faces more than 100 felony counts after a grand jury handed up indictments in the case.

---

Two former Minneapolis police officers were sentenced to about three years in prison for violating the civil rights of George Floyd.
